message.content:
cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR. 

The paper deals with the task of eXplainable Question Answering (XQA) for Visual Question Answering (VQA) problem, which involves generating natural language explanations for an image-based question answering task. This task involves the use of scene graphs and visual attention maps to generate textual explanations. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition), followed by cs.CL (Computation and Language) as the paper deals with natural language generation. The paper also involves the use of machine learning models for generating explanations, which falls under the sub-categories of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). Finally, the paper involves the use of attention mechanisms, which falls under the sub-category of cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
